content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Speed limits in Singapore" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(July 2018)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* Generally, the **speed limits** in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) are 50 km/h unless stated otherwise. The [speed limit](/wiki/Speed_limit) is restricted to 40 km/h in [School Zones](/wiki/School_zone), and 40 km/h or 30 km/h in Silver Zones. Most [expressways](/wiki/Expressways_of_Singapore) have speed limits of either 80 km/h or 90 km/h. Offenders who are caught [speeding](/wiki/Speed_limit) will be fined and/or jailed. This article about transport in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about [law](/wiki/Law) in Asia is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Speed limits in Singapore
